intro: Icuria, commonly known as the bluebells, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Campanulaceae. These plants are characterized by their bell-shaped flowers, which are typically blue or purple in color. Icuria species are often found in moist, woodland environments, thriving in partial shade. They have lance-shaped leaves and produce showy blooms during the spring season. The genus includes several species, such as Icuria corymbosa, which is native to parts of Europe and Asia.
